definitions.definition: break the connection of or between.
examples: take all violence out of television drama and you disconnect it from reality
synonyms: unyoke More"the trucks were disconnected from the train"separate
remove "she felt as if she were disconnected from the real world"

definitions.definition: take (an electrical device) out of action by detaching it from a power supply.
examples: deactivate, shut off, turn off, switch off, unplug an engineer disconnected the power source

definitions.definition: interrupt or terminate (a telephone conversation) by breaking the connection.
examples: that might explain why her call got disconnected mid-expletive

definitions.definition: terminate the connection of (a household) to water, electricity, gas, or telephone, typically because of nonpayment of bills.
